Reviews.Title: So far so good (Update, still great after 10 months!)
Reviews.Author: Kelly Daniels "shadeybeep"
Reviews.Content: I bought this a few weeks ago, and so far it's met all of my expectations.First of all -- things that I had trouble finding out in advance:  There is a headphone jack on the side, which can be used as an analog audio out (I'm pretty sure it came with a cable even -- 3.5mm to audio RCA connector) -- in addition to the optical digital audio out which is on the back.  I haven't tested this yet, so I couldn't say if there is an actual difference in sound quality between either of the sources.  I also don't know if it can output sound through both at the same time.Also, although the stand and "frame" are glossy, the actual screen has a matte anti-glare coating which I find works very well.As a TV:  It looks great! I have it hooked up through component cables to my comcast dvr .. no issues at all.  Plugged it in, and it just worked.  The default display setting for some reason was the "vivid" color profile..  I played around with settings a bit, but I decided I like the vivid profile the best anyway.One feature that I really like is that it can be set to adjust the aspect ratio automatically based on the programming.  So when I switch to non-HD channels the aspect automatically adjusts, so I don't have to see any stretched faces.  I don't have to ever press the aspect button to change it.  Of course if you prefer to set it manually, it lets you do that too.As a computer monitor:  I'm currently using DVI.  It looked great when I first plugged it in.  Some of this might be my video card, but it automatically selected the best resolution, etc.  It was possibly a little too blue-ish for my taste (probably only because I have it right next to a gateway lcd which is a little brighter and has more "warm" tones, which I prefer -- if the second monitor wasn't sitting right next to it, I think I'd have gotten used to it immediately).  I adjusted the display settings, which helped a bit, and then adjusted the video card settings which helped a lot more. The second I told windows to use my video card color/video settings rather than windows, it looks PERFECT.  I also adjusted the gamma on the monitor, I like my display to be very bright.I can't comment on the sound (my dvr and computer's audio goes directly to my receiver), or the remote (I use a logitech harmony, it was very easy to set up).  I also can't comment on the built in hdtv tuner, I never hooked up an antenna or cable line directly to the tv, and it won't pick up any channels without one or the other.The only con that I can think of right now is the fact that there are no dedicated buttons for changing the input mode. You have to scroll through them -- although with the exception of the TV input (coaxial) it will not select sources that are not plugged in, which is nice.  I would have liked if it wouldn't select "TV" unless I had something plugged in to that input, but it's not that big of a deal.Oddly, even though there aren't any dedicated input buttons, my harmony remote was still somehow able to get it to switch directly to component from any other input..  This did not work with any of the other input sources though, just component.  Maybe there is a hidden functionality in there somewhere, though.. I might look into it one day.Oh, it also takes a little longer than I would like to "wake up" but I am very impatient in general, this might not bother most people.Anyway, I think this is a great monitor and a great tv, and I am VERY happy with my purchase!  I just wish I'd been able to afford the 27" instead!EDIT 11/08/11:I still am loving this monitor.  Since my original review, I've added a PS3 to my setup using the HDMI connector, and used the optical digital audio out on the monitor to my receiver -- sound and video are both perfect.Also, in addition to getting my harmony remote to select component input without cycling through, it was also able to directly select the A/V input (I believe that's composite).. although, I currently have nothing plugged into that one.  Still, might be important information for other people.  I have yet to figure out any way to get the monitor to directly select any input other than component and A/V.  If I could I would upgrade my rating, since the time it takes to cycle through inputs is the only thing keeping me from considering this a 5 star monitor.

Reviews.Title: As advertised!
Reviews.Author: WillyD
Reviews.Content: It's rare when you make a purchase of a quality product, at a great price, free shipping, smooth delivery! But it happened as advertised! Good work.

Reviews.Title: A great monitor and TV for the price
Reviews.Author: Glenn Cooper
Reviews.Content: I bought this specifically to have the combined function of T.V. and monitor.  It seems great as a television, and pretty darned good as a monitor.  I have a few similar sized Dell monitors (which are dedicated monitors) and the appearance of text on the Dell monitors is slightly better than on the LG.  But the screen still looks great and is very livable.  I'm very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Another great LG Product
Reviews.Author: Pat
Reviews.Content: I purchased a LG flat screen two years ago and am very pleased with it.  When my son's wanted a LCD TV Monitor, I went searching for a LG.  I bought two of these TV monitor's and they exceeded my expectations.  The sound and clarity are amazing using it as a TV or monitor.  Both of my son's are very in tune with technology out there today and they were very pleased.  They had them setup and running in less than 10 minutes.  I am now thinking about getting one for myself and I will stick with LG since they have not failed me yet.

Reviews.Title: Great Monitor!
Reviews.Author: Alice Y
Reviews.Content: The first one came with a scratched screen and Amazon's service has simply been amazing. No hassle returns/replacements. I was able to print a prepaid shipping label to return it right away and the very next day, they had already shipped me a replacement that arrived at super speed. I'm happy to say that the replacement is perfect. I use this for my computer and have had no problems since. Very crisp and clear. I've researched quite a lot of monitors online and have found this one to be the best in both quality and price. Also, Amazon's service brings it way over the top. Thank you so much!

Reviews.Title: Not too shabby
Reviews.Author: Wayofthespoon
Reviews.Content: I recently bought this monitor/tv, and I have been very pleased so far.  I use computer speakers, so the audio isn't a problem for me.  The resolution is pretty darn good, a full 1080p.  I haven't had enough time to go through every single feature, but so far, I am very happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great Monitor/TV
Reviews.Author: Acsen
Reviews.Content: Just great, no dead pixels, nice design.  Easy to set upCons: Sound, not much bass even with the "SRS TruSurround XT" on

Reviews.Title: Great display! Ok Sound
Reviews.Author: Jeri Zerr "formerly a Road Warrior of the Nth...
Reviews.Content: We bought this LG HDTV to be used primarily as a monitor due to the larger screen, secondary to watch tv and videos on the widescreen display.We like the fact AAA batteries included for the remote as well as the DB-15 cable to connect to the computer AND the audio cable (mini stereo on both ends) to connect the "monitors speakers" to the computer.  We're running the Gigabyte ATI Radeon HD4350 512 MB PCI-Express Video Card GV-R435OC-512I for an excellent display! We are using the 15 pin output from the video card to this LG HDTV as a monitor and the HDMI output to a 46" Philips LCD HDTV for presentation purposes. This is a good combination for anyone wanting to display HD on their home theater and use the PC-15 pin for the tv being used as a monitor.Update: We've been using this TV as a monitor for several months now. The picture is GREAT! The sound is quite suitable for watching movies. We are audiophiles so we feel the sound could be "better" but it's perfectly fine for the average user hence we've upgraded the review from 4 star to 5 star. Kudo's to LG for another GREAT product at an excellent price point. Even months later this unit is still the best priced unit currently on the market when factoring in the features and quality. When we were recently looking around for a replacement computer monitor (another Acerview monitor bit the dust) we again found this HDTV to be such a good value we ordered a second unit. Kudo's to LG for a great product at a great price!

Reviews.Title: great TV
Reviews.Author: rich1896
Reviews.Content: Was looking for a replacement for a Philips TV that did not meet expectations, found this at a great price, and have been very happy with its performance as a TV. Very sharp picture with true color, easy on the eyes, good sound. Wide angle of view with little color changes (as many LCD TVs tend to have). Was actually surprised to see as many ratings with less than 5 stars. Exceeds all of my expectations. Have not used it as a monitor, so can't comment on that part of its performance.

Reviews.Title: Great Monitor/TV
Reviews.Author: Ryan
Reviews.Content: I use this in my home office as a second television but primarily as a computer monitor. I play video games on it, PC, PS3, Wii, and the response time and color display are great. The picture is crystal clear and the variety of connections is very convenient. (DVI, HDMI, Composite, Component, Coaxial Cable) It was one of the only Monitor/TV combos to offer a digital connection, DVI, most of the ones I looked at only offered analog connection, RGB. It would be nice if it had picture in picture so you could have the television portion on while working on the computer but overall it works great as a computer monitor and a TV.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: SBaker5373
Reviews.Content: This was exactly what I was looking for and way less expensive than it could have been.  I am currently deployed to Iraq and give the highest recommendation!

Reviews.Title: Super monitor
Reviews.Author: Dunn
Reviews.Content: This was my one splurge when recently buying an building my new computer. It was well worth it. Has a hookup for anything an everything. Tv tuner and built in speakers, along with hook-ups, were the selling point for me. The tv tuner needs to be in an amazing reception spot to work on it's own, despite what everyone else says if you look IN THE MANUAL, it suggests to use the antenna to get the channels to work. That's common sence. Otherwise I don't notice any bleeding(only on Fallout 3) so that's not a worry. Makes my Blu-Ray movies look better then on the HDTV in the living room. I highly recommend this.

Reviews.Title: LG has made its own name!
Reviews.Author: Marco Ahumada "Marco Smoked"
Reviews.Content: This LCD TV/Monitor is great for hooking up multiple devices. In my particular case I have connected: TV antenna -coaxial input-, Sattelite -A/V component-, computer -DVI-, & Blue-Ray player -HDMI-.The quality of the images is excellent.I recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Grainy, poor sharpness, not considered a TV by Amazon
Reviews.Author: Tedzilla
Reviews.Content: Looked good on the website, but it didn't live up to the hype.  DVD movies and TV content from cable service had noticible graininess and blurry edges, especially with text.  Second, the day after I ordered it, I noticed that Amazon had reduced the selling price by $50 (from 269 to 219), but Amazon would not honor a price-matching reduction because this item is considered a computer electronics item (a "TV Monitor") not a "TV".  Worth looking at Amazon's price matching policies and exactly how they classify an particular "TV" before you buy one of these gizmos from them; basically they seem to only honor price matching for TV's.  I thought I was purchasing a TV.  Needless to say, this unit went back to Amazon the day after it arrived for a full refund (I presume/hope), and I've subsequently purchased a "real" TV (LG 22LE5300).

Reviews.Title: Looks really good, great picture.
Reviews.Author: Rich Hampton
Reviews.Content: I am using this TV Monitor on my kitchen counter under the cabinet. Perfect size, don't have to squint. The picture is very clear. Would like to see a picture freeze button to read the fine print of some adds. While watching some stations there is a 1 second delay between the sound and the movement of lips of the speaker. Haven't figured out weather the issue is caused by the monitor or the cable company. Doesn't seem to be on all stations. Seemed to be one of the few 1080P available for this size. Happy with that.

Reviews.Title: Monitor 5/10 TV 0/10 Yuck
Reviews.Author: Raymond Rogoway
Reviews.Content: I purchased this set as for use as a TV in my computer room. I returned this set for use as anything. It may be just ok as a computer monitor but as a TV it is useless. The reasons (1) it is designed to be viewed head on. If viewed from below (as if on wall) everything fades to dark. Viewed from the side produces similar but not as dark results. Best used right in front of your nose. (2) The speakers are on the back of the set and the audio amplifier is very low powered. There is no headphone jack so the only external amp you can use has to be digital. (3) The TV tuner has be minimal. The picture was noisy, even using the noise reduction settings. I even tried a video amp but could never get a completely noise free picture. (4) The color is washed out and even trying to adjust the settings never gave me a vivid picture.My recommendation...not useful even as a computer monitor. Not worth the price.

Reviews.Title: Worst TV Ever
Reviews.Author: Hyunki Kim
Reviews.Content: This television set is unsatisfactory for any type of use. Using it for a COMPUTER monitor was okay, but as a television, the screen turns black, with the sound resuming as if nothing is happening. You can restart the TV, but to no avail. I returned the TV to get it fixed. When I received it from FedEx, LG has made it look like it was fixed. They have added a sticker that reads,"Refurbished," and the TV was fine for a couple of days. Then the problem recurred. Looking online for help, this problem has been around for 3 years. LG could never fix this problem. Their products are unsatisfactory, their customer service is atrocious, and buying this 'television' will be one of the worst decisions you will make in your life.

Reviews.Title: HATED this Tv.
Reviews.Author: Hilary-Danielle Kaplan
Reviews.Content: This is a waste of time and money. It had a burn out already in the screen (little green lines) and it never fully connected correctly--- even after Comcast came out. Comcast said it was a bad TV and even worse, it was an LG and their quality sucked. I just ordered and got a Samsung 42" Plasma and I LOVEEEEEEEEEEE it!!! Works great.. no problems at all. Save your money and time.. go with Panasonic or Samsung!
